item.title: Report I-2024090048
item.description:
Report I-2024090048

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-15
  • City: BLAUVELT
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS, LABELS, AND SHIPPING PAPERS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS OF THIS UNMARKED BOX WE DISCOVERED ONE SHOCK ABSORBER PART NUMBER 68234553AD. THE DEVICE IS MARKED CAUTION OIL AND GAS UNDER HIGH PRESSURE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. HAZ IS SHOWING ON A PRODUCT LABEL ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. SUPPLEMENTAL REPORT BEING SUBMITTED TO VOID THE 5800 FOR AN INCORRECTLY REPORTED UNDECLARED PACKAGE. MOPAR HAZMAT DANGEROUS GOODS CONFIRMED THIS PRODUCT SHIPS UNDER 49CFR 173.306(F)(4). THE PACKAGE WAS NOT REQUIRED TO HAVE HAZMAT CLASSIFICATION LABELS, MARKS, SHIPPING PAPER, OR UN SPECIFICATION PACKAGING TO SHIP THE PRODUCT ALSO MEETS IATA REGULATIONS SPECIAL PROVISION All4. NO VIOLATION. REPORT X-2024090276, INCIDENT 907656, TRACKING 44329. PART VII- RECOMMENDATIONS/ACTIONS TAKEN TO PREVENT RECURRENCE

item.title: Report E-2024090421
item.description:
Report E-2024090421

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-19
  • City: MASPETH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer, material handler discovered a plastic drum that had fallen over due to improper preparation for transportation. Apparently, when the drum fell over a small crack developed on the bottom as a result of the drum getting pinched on the pallet it was staged on when it fell over that consequently contributed to the unintentional release. Spilled material was neutralized and cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the cracked drum.

item.title: Report E-2024090422
item.description:
Report E-2024090422

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-19
  • City: CASTLETON ON HUDSON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading freight material handler discovered a box that was slightly wet. Further investigation discovered that the box had been punctured by either a forklift forkblade or other freight consequently puncturing an inner plastic bottle contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured box and inner receptacle.

item.title: Report E-2024090424
item.description:
Report E-2024090424

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-10
  • City: CONGERS
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 10, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of isopropyl alcohol was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. All spilled isopropyl alcohol had evaporated prior to the crew's arrival. One (1) 55-gallon metal drum of isopropyl alcohol was over packed for transport and disposal. Crews transported the over packed drum to the Newburgh (Montgomery) R+L Terminal
